Minichamps 430748101 Ford Escort RS1600 1974 RAC Rally Winner T. Mäkinen/H. Liddon

3rd WRC win for Timo Mäkinen
4th WRC win for Ford
4th WRC win for Escort RS1600



1974 was the second season for the World Rally Championship. Due to the worldwide oil crisis, the inaugural season’s 13 events were reduced to 8. Timo Mäkinen competed in 3 of the events driving a Peugeot 504 with John Davenport on the Safari Rally and a Ford Escort RS1600 with Henry Liddon on the 1,000 Lakes Rally and RAC Rally.

After finishing second in his "home" event, Mäkinen was surely looking to repeat his win in the 1973 RAC Rally. Mäkinen took the lead from Sandro Munari driving a Lancia Stratos in SS18. He was able to hold on to the lead through the next 62 :!: contested special stages to win the event. At the time there was still no Driver’s Championship but the win earned Ford 20 points in the Manufacturers’ Championship. Ford ended the season in third place behind Lancia and Fiat.
